definition: to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need
erhua variant of 消食[xiao1 shi2]

sentences.english: After a while he began to feel sleepy and decided that he would lie down and disgest his meal in comfort.
sentences.chinese: 不一会儿他有些犯困，便决定还是先躺下来消消食。
山楂健脾开胃消食，脂肪。

sentences.english: This shop has for sale every kind of tonic that helps stimulate appetite and digestion.
sentences.chinese: 各种开胃消食的补品，本店应有尽有。

sentences.english: An old goodman of a priest, who passes along mumbling his prayers?
sentences.chinese: 杀害一个念着消食经过路的老教士？

sentences.english: Chinese hawthorn Gan Suanwei is warm, is whets the appetite the digestion, the enhancement digestion function good medicine.
sentences.chinese: 山楂甘酸微温，是开胃消食，增强消化功能的良药。

sentences.english: It was preliminary suggested that adding the crude and the fried product into digest…
sentences.chinese: 初步认为山楂入消食药以生品或炒品为佳。

sentences.english: The effect of this Chinese medicine is to stimulate appetite and digestion.
sentences.chinese: 这类中药的药效是开胃消食。

sentences.english: The papaya promotes good digestion too.
sentences.chinese: 木瓜也有助于消食健胃。

sentences.english: This medicine will work up an appetite.
sentences.chinese: 这类中药的药效是开胃消食。

sentences.english: She began to harp us to drink after dinner.
sentences.chinese: 用餐后，她开始弹奏起竖琴让我们饮酒消食。

definition: to whet the appetite/appetizing/to amuse oneself at sb's expense/to tease
to alleviate fever (medicine)/to clear internal heat (Chinese medicine)
hawthorn tree (rose family, genus Crataegus)/rose hip (hawthorn fruit)
to moisten the lungs/to make expectoration easy (medicine)
to dissipate the effects of alcohol
(TCM) to rectify 氣|气[qi4] and transform phlegm
to spend a summer holiday/(esp of Chinese medicine) to relieve summer heat
